Title: Pun
References: ŠTULAJTEROVÁ, A., JESENSKÁ, P.: English Stylistics. 1. vyd. Banská Bystrica : Univerzita Mateja Bela, 2013. 114 s.
Content:
A pun is a play on words in which a humorous effect is produced by using a word that suggests two or more meanings. 

Because the whole point of a pun is to produce a humorous or a witty effect, they commonly occur in verbal humour. Nowadays it is increasingly used in newspaper headlines as an attention-getting device.

examples:

  • A horse is a very stable animal. 
  • An elephant's oppinion carries a lot of weight.
